definition: to be surprised/to be amazed/to be stunned
to startle/to be frightened/to be scared/alarm

sentences.english: The comments are overwhelmingly disapprovals to my conclusion.
sentences.chinese: 正是這些評語使我驚詫不已。

sentences.english: We were amazed. We had never seen flowers in the snow.
sentences.chinese: 我們驚詫不已，從未見過能傲雪綻放的花朵。

sentences.english: He looked at me in blank amazement.
sentences.chinese: 他帶着迷茫驚詫的神情望着我。

sentences.english: "The biggest surprise was chromium, " Mr Payne said.
That finding surprised the company, which said it was unaware of them.
sentences.chinese: 這項發現令該公司感到驚詫，他們對此毫無察覺。

sentences.english: I was amazed at his efficiency.
sentences.chinese: 他工作效率之高讓我驚詫。

sentences.english: Etiquette entertained the troops A fine willow camp gate, many exchequer was flabbergasted.
sentences.chinese: 出了細柳軍營的大門，許多大臣都深感驚詫。

sentences.english: But Knowles' amazing tale made me think.
sentences.chinese: 諾爾斯的故事令人驚詫，也讓我陷入思考。

sentences.english: The captain to Deputy instinct was said.
sentences.chinese: 大尉於協理員本能的驚詫說。

sentences.english: As Ed looked at his unform,he was very surprised.
sentences.chinese: 當Edk看到他的校服的時候，他非常驚詫。

sentences.english: You may be surprised with your answer.
sentences.chinese: 你會對你的答案驚詫不已。

sentences.english: The violinist's virtuosity has amazed audiences all over the world.
sentences.chinese: 小提琴家的精湛技藝使全世界的觀衆驚詫不已。

sentences.english: As far as occupations are concerned, the range is staggering.
sentences.chinese: 說到會員的職業，其範圍之廣更是令人驚詫不已。

sentences.english: The scene was astonishing to me, to every one standing by.
sentences.chinese: 這情景使我和每一位旁觀者都很驚詫。

sentences.english: She astonished me with her beautiful handwriting.
sentences.chinese: 她以其秀媚的書法而使我驚詫。

definition: to be startled/to be shocked/to be amazed
to exclaim in admiration/a gasp of surprise
to have a surprise (idiom); shocked or startled/gobsmacked
to be eager to give sth a try (idiom)
to click one's tongue in wonder (idiom)/to be astonished
overwhelmed with shock, horror or amazement/dumbstruck/aghast
